#### Question and Answers


* **a** 
&nbsp;
  + **(i)** Regress FGPA on a constant and SATV. Report the coefficient of SATV and its standard error and p-value
(give your answers with 3 decimals).
&nbsp;
+ **Answers:** 

Table 1     |Estimate | std error | p-value
:-----------|:--------|:----------|:-----------
(Intercept) | 2.44173 |   0.15506 | <2e-16
SATV        | 0.06309 |   0.02766 | 0.0229  


&nbsp;
  
  +  **(ii)** Determine a 95% confidence interval (with 3 decimals) for the effect on FGPA of an increase by 1 point
in SATV.

&nbsp;


+ **Answers:** 

Confidence Interval (95%) = intercept +/- (2*(SE))

Lower Limit = 0.0630 - 2*0.02766 = 0.0076

Upper Limit = 0.0630 + 2*0.02766 = 0.1183





&nbsp;
&nbsp;


* **(b)** Answer questions (a-i) and (a-ii) also for the regression of FGPA on a constant, SATV, SATM, and FEM.

&nbsp;

+ **Answers:**

Table 2     |Estimate   | std error | p-value
:-----------|:----------|:----------|:-----------
(Intercept) |  1.55705  |  0.21610  |1.73e-12 
SATV        |  0.01416  |  0.02793  |0.612       
SATM        |  0.17274  |  0.03193  |9.07e-08
FEM         |  0.20027  |  0.03738  |1.20e-07 


Confidence Interval (95%) = intercept +/- (2*(SE))

Lower Limit = 0.01416 - 2*0.02766 = -0.04116

Upper Limit = 0.01416 + 2*0.02766 = 0.06948

#### Method

### Load the library
```{r, message=FALSE}
library(readxl)
```

### Load the Data
```{r}

setwd("~/Personal not your shit/H./Online Classes/R programming/Econometrics/Week2")

data <- read_xls(paste0(getwd(), '/data/TestExer2-GPA-round2.xls'))

```

### Fitting a linear line

```{r}
model1 <- lm(FGPA~SATV, data)
summary(model1)
```

Confidence Interval (95%) = intercept +/- (2*(SE))

Lower Limit = 0.0630 - 2*0.02766 = 0.0076

Upper Limit = 0.0630 + 2*0.02766 = 0.1183




```{r}
model2 <- lm(FGPA~SATV+SATM+FEM, data)

summary(model2)
```

Confidence Interval (95%) = intercept +/- (2*(SE))

Lower Limit = 0.01416 - 2*0.02766 = -0.04116

Upper Limit = 0.01416 + 2*0.02766 = 0.06948




```{r}
dataCorr <- subset(data, select = c("FGPA","SATM","SATV","FEM"))

cor <-cor(dataCorr)

cor
```

```{r, message=FALSE, fig.width=5, fig.height=5}
library(corrplot)

corrplot.mixed(cor, lower.col = 'black')

```


```{r}
model3 <- lm(FGPA~SATM+FEM, data)

summary(model3)
```


```{r}
ssr <- sum((model3$residuals)^2)
ssr
```

```{r}

ssr <-  sum((model2$residuals)^2)

ssr
```


```{r}
anova(model2, model3)
```
